question:
Which of the following is / are correct statements about index of core industries:
  1. It is compiled and published by Central Statistics Office (CSO).
  2. It is published monthly to provide an indication on production performance of industries of ‘core’ nature before the release of Index of Industrial Production (IIP).
  3. The eight core industries are Coal, Crude Oil, Natural Gas, Refinery Products, Fertilizer, Steel Cement, and Electricity.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
The recent data for the index of eight core industries with base year 2011-12 has been released by Ministry of Commerce and Industry on 31october 2018.Due to decline in crude oil production and natural gas production the index decline to 4.3 percent in September 2018. Key facts
  • It is compiled and published by Central Statistics Office (CSO).
  • It is published monthly to provide an indication on production performance of industries of ‘core’ nature before the release of Index of Industrial Production(IIP).
  • The eight core industries are Coal, Crude Oil, Natural Gas, Refinery Products, Fertilizer, Steel Cement, and Electricity.
The revised weightings are: Coal (weight: 10.33per cent), Crude Oil (weight: 8.98per cent), Natural Gas (weight: 6.88per cent) Petroleum Refinery (weight: 28.04per cent), Fertilizers production (weight: 2.63 per cent), Steel production (weight: 17.92per cent), Cement production (weight: 5.37per cent), Electricity generation (weight: 19.85per cent).
